Strategy เพิ่ม Bitcoin อีก 75 ล้านดอลลาร์ ขณะที่เทรดเดอร์คุ้มครองความเสี่ยงสำหรับราคา 70,000 ดอลลาร์

Strategy adds $75m more Bitcoin as traders hedge for $70,000 price

3d ago//Lance Datskoluo
bitcoin
AI

Summary

TH

สตราเทกี้ได้ซื้อบิตคอยน์เพิ่มอีก 75.3 ล้านดอลลาร์สหรัฐ ทำให้มีทรัพย์สินรวมเป็นบิตคอยน์ 54 พันล้านดอลลาร์ ณ ราคาเฉลี่ยต่อเหรียญที่ 76,052 ดอลลาร์สหรัฐ การซื้อเพิ่มนี้เกิดขึ้นในขณะที่ราคาบิตคอยน์ลดลง 15% ในเดือนที่ผ่านมา จากความไม่แน่นอนในตลาดและปัจจัยทางภูมิรัฐศาสตร์ รวมถึงการแต่งตั้งเควิน วอร์ชในตำแหน่งประธานธนาคารกลางสหรัฐ ซึ่งอาจนำนโยบายเงินเฟ้อที่ strict มากขึ้น แม้ว่าจะมีการซื้อที่เพิ่มขึ้น แต่นักวิเคราะห์บางคนยังคงมีมุมมองเชิงลบ โดยเชื่อว่าบิตคอยน์อาจลงไปถึงราคา 70,000 ดอลลาร์สหรัฐ หรือแม้กระทั่ง 10,000 ดอลลาร์สหรัฐตามคำทำนายของบลูมเบิร์ก

EN

Strategy has purchased an additional $75.3 million in Bitcoin, bringing their total holdings to $54 billion at an average purchase price of $76,052 per BTC. This buying comes amid a 15% decline in Bitcoin's price over the past month, driven by market uncertainty and geopolitical factors including the potential nomination of hawkish Federal Reserve chair Kevin Warsh. Despite the price drop, investors poured $562 million into spot Bitcoin ETFs on Monday, showing continued institutional interest. However, some analysts remain bearish, with Derive.xyz's Nick Forster suggesting traders are positioning for a drop to $70,000, and Bloomberg Intelligence's Mike McGlone doubling down on his $10,000 Bitcoin prediction.

Key Points

  • Strategy purchased additional $75.3 million in Bitcoin, now holding $54 billion total
  • Bitcoin ETFs saw $562 million in investment despite 15% price drop
  • Potential hawkish Federal Reserve leadership causing uncertainty about tighter monetary policy
  • Some analysts predict Bitcoin could drop to $70,000 or even $10,000
  • Current Bitcoin price is $78,761 (up 2.3%) and Ethereum is at $2,317 (up 3%)

Article

Strategy now holds $54 billion in Bitcoin. Traders are positioning for further downside, analysts say. ETFs saw $562 million in investment. Strategy purchased another $75.3 million in Bitcoin, executive chairman Michael Saylor announced on Monday. The crypto treasury firm now holds just over $54 billion in Bitcoin purchased at an average price of $76,052 per coin. Plenty of other Bitcoin believers are buying the dip as well. Investors poured $562 million into spot Bitcoin exchange-traded funds on Monday, according to DefiLlama data . The buying spree comes as Bitcoin’s price has been hammered by over 15% in the past month, due in part to market uncertainty and geopolitical unrest. That chaos cocktail includes US President Donald Trump’s nomination of interest rate hawk Kevin Warsh as the next Federal Reserve boss, ongoing tariff threats, the fatal shootings in Minneapolis, and Trump’s seeming indifference toward a weaker dollar. Crypto bloodbath Warsh’s nomination is a major U-turn by Trump, who has long insisted on lower interest rates. A hawkish Fed means fewer and slower rate cuts, meaning less money in the financial system to boost asset prices like Bitcoin, stocks, or gold. To be sure, Warsh still needs to be confirmed by the Senate, and consensus on interest rates must be reached with other Fed governors. “Investors turned bearish after news about new US Federal Reserve leadership appointments, raising fears that monetary policy could remain tighter for longer,” Erikka Arone, senior vice-president at crypto-trading platform sFOX, told DL News . Bitcoin is trading 38% below its all-time high and has lagged behind other assets, such as stocks and gold, since the $1 trillion October wipeout. “It’s been a bloodbath across crypto markets over the past few days,” Nick Forster, founder of Derive.xyz, said in an investor note shared with DL News . He said that traders are now positioning for a drop to as low as $70,000 per Bitcoin. “Short-term fear is dominating market psychology,” he said. “This reflects acute uncertainty in the immediate term.” And Forster is far from the only bearish voice. On Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence strategist Mike McGlone doubled down on his $10,000 prediction for Bitcoin. Crypto market movers Bitcoin is up 2.3% over the past 24 hours, trading at $78,761. Ethereum is up 3% past 24 hours at $2,317. What we’re reading What is Moltbook?
